#summary jQuery Widget with Core Framrwork

= Widget =
jQuery Widget example with Core Framework
{{{
Core.jQuery.widget('ui.observer', Core.extend(
{
	options:
	{
		version: 1.0
	},
	observe: function()
	{
		this.element.data('Timestamp', new Date().getTime());
	},
	_create: function()
	{
		/* Bind simple click listener */
		this.element.bind('click',this.delegate(this, this.observe))
	}
}));
}}}
The example above will create simple widget *$.ui.obersver* which can be used like this:
{{{
$('ul > li').observer();
}}}

= Widget mixins =
widget() method allows one to mixin existing widgets and thus achieve multiple widget inheritance through mixins
{{{
/* Base widget */
Core.jQuery.widget('ui.customWidget',
{
	customMethod: function()
	{
		this.element.fadeOut(300);
	}
})


/* User defined widget that has access to base widget*/
Core.jQuery.widget('ui.observer',
{
	_create: function()
	{
		/* Call method from Base widget */
		this.customMethod();
		
		/* Another way to call methods from base widget*/
		this.getMixin('custom').customMethod();
	},
	mixins:
	{
		custom: $.ui.customWidget
	}
});
}}}
